question: One revolution of a conductor through the magnetic field of a basic generator will produce two complete sine waves.
A sine wave's peak-to-peak voltage value is always twice its peak voltage value.
If a wave has frequency of 2 Hz, it has a period of ?
A 1 Hz sine wave has a period of 1 s.
The instantaneous voltage at 120° on a 5 V peak sine wave equals about –4.33 V.
A sine wave has only one positive maximum point during a cycle.
The sine of a given angle is equal to the ratio of the hypotenuse to the opposite side.
The square, rectangular, and sawtooth waveforms are nonsymmetrical.
10,000 cycles will occur in 5 s if a sine wave's frequency equals 2 kHz.
If you increase the rotational speed of the conductor in a basic generator, the frequency of the resulting sine wave voltage will increase.
The rms voltage value is a measure of a sine wave's heating effect.
